page.title: 04BORELAND FARMLAND, KIRKCOWAN
page.content: Because the land is{steep}and{stony} very little is used for crops and most is{rough grazing.}The farmer ploughs 40 acres for{barley,}uses 80 acres for {silage}and has 40 acres in{hay.}The rest of his 600 acres is uncultivated. A 4 wheel drive tractor has to be used to prepare the land for the crop.Large quantities of{fertiliser}are used to produce{big crops.}A chopper is used to make 2 cuts of silage in the season.Harvesting the barley is done by combine harvester.Fences have been put round fields to make them smaller. {In the past}the main food crops were{ {turnips}and{oats}but these are now uncommon.When the farmer first farmed Boreland,the crop was cut by scythe and threshed in a mill,because he had{ {no machinery}he produced{less feeding} and kept{fewer animals.}
